meanings.definition: To give a surface a marble-like appearance.
meanings.sent1: She was marbleizing the table to make it look like expensive marble.
meanings.sent2: The artist marbleized the walls of the gallery to add elegance.
meanings.sent3: The children had fun marbleizing their school project with colorful paints.
meanings.sent4: Her skilled hands marbleized the plain paper into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays marbleized the water, creating a beautiful reflection.

meanings.definition: The act of creating a marble-like pattern on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The marbleizing of the floor made the room look grand.
meanings.sent2: She learned the art of marbleizing from her grandmother.
meanings.sent3: The marbleizing on the cake made it look too pretty to eat.
meanings.sent4: The marbleizing on the fabric gave it a luxurious feel.
meanings.sent5: The marbleizing on the walls added a touch of sophistication to the room.
